author: Kwirirai
body:
# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
Get-PSDrive
```

# Expected behavior

```none
Used (GB)     Free (GB)
300              600
```

# Actual behavior

```none
Name           Used (GB)     Free (GB) Provider      Root                                               CurrentLocation
----           ---------     --------- --------      ----                                               ---------------
C                                      FileSystem    C:\
```

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.18362.752
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.18362.752
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
@Kwirirai PowerShell version 5.1 is not being maintained anymore outside of security-critical bug fixes. You can submit feedback for it in UserVoice, but I'm unsure if that will go anywhere currently.

Feel free to try out the latest version of PowerShell (7.0) or a preview version on the [releases page](./../releases). If the issue still exists in the current version, we can look at getting it fixed for future versions of PS. 🙂

comments.author: Kwirirai
comments.body: PowerShell 7 works for me, Thank you.

title: Get-PSDrive C returns blank used/free disk space
